required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcomes for Medicare Asthma Patients Taking Fluticasone Propionate/Salmeterol Xinafoate Combination Versus Inhaled Corticosteroids or Other Combination Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Outcomes for Medicare Asthma Patients Taking Fluticasone Propionate/Salmeterol Xinafoate Combination Versus Inhaled Corticosteroids or Other Combination Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to compare healthcare utilization and costs in Medicare-eligible asthma patients (aged >65) who receive fluticasone propionate/salmeterol xinafoate combination or inhaled corticosteroids in a typical clinical practice using a retrospective observational cohort study design of large managed care database. Outcomes on interest include asthma related severe exacerbations defined as asthma related emergency department visits, hospitalizations or combined emergency department/hospitalization. Other outcomes of interest include use of albuterol, oral corticosteroids and overall asthma related costs. Outcomes of interest will be compared between the two treatment cohorts (fluticasone propionate/salmeterol xinafoate combination or inhaled corticosteroids). Dichotomous outcomes (emergency visits, hospitalizations etc) will be compared using Cox regression hazards analysis assessing time to first event for each asthma related endpoint adjusting for differences in baseline demographics such as age, gender, previous asthma medication use, co morbidities, costs, and plan demographics. Total asthma related costs will also be compared using generalized linear models adjusting for baseline differences.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of Post-index Asthma-related Events Measured Using Medical and Pharmacy Claims
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 years from July 1, 2001 to June 30, 2008
primary_outcome.description: Asthma-related events were defined as events with any primary ICD-9 code of 493.xx for hospitalizations, emergency department visits, and combined hospitalization/emergency department visits. The post-index period is defined as 3-12 months after either the first administration of fluticasone propionate and salmetrol or inhaled corticosteroids. Medical and pharmacy claims are recorded healthcare encounters in a large managed care administrative insurance database.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Asthma-related Costs in the Post-index Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 years from July 1, 2001 to June 30, 2008
secondary_outcome.description: Asthma-related costs were calculated as pharmacy costs, medical costs, and total asthma (pharmacy plus medical) costs. Medical costs were made up of asthma-related visits, hospitalizations, emergency department visits, and medical office visits. Pharmacy costs were comprised of all asthma-related medications used during the follow-up period. Medical services were identified by place of service and PharMetrics-specific confinement codes. Prescriptions were counted by 30-day fills, with fills less than 30 days rounded up to indicate one fill.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of Albuterol (Short-acting Î²-Agonists) Canisters Dispensed Per Pharmacy Claim Per Participant
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 years from July 1, 2001 to June 30, 2008
secondary_outcome.description: The number of albuterol canisters dispensed was used as a surrogate marker of asthma symptoms.

arm_group.description: Asthma subjects at least 65 years of age enrolled in a large Medicare managed care health plan.

intervention.description: Fluticasone propionate/salmeterol xinafoate combination for asthma, all doses (100mcg/50mcg, 250 mcg/50mcg and 500 mcg/50mcg)
Inhaled corticosteroids: beclomethasone dipropionte, mometasone, fluticasone propionate, budesonide, and flunisolide

study_pop.textblock: Medicare-eligible subjects age 65 years and older with a diagnosis of asthma being treated with an inhaled corticosteroid

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with asthma as determined by ICD-9 codes and asthma drug use
- at least 65 years of age
- prescription for an inhaled corticosteroid
Exclusion Criteria:
- a diagnosis of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease or
- a prescription for a chronic obstructive pulmonary disease treatment

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Fluticasone Propionate, Salmeterol Xinafoate Drug Combination

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients were not recruited for nor enrolled in this study. This study is a retrospective observational study. Data from medical records or insurance claims databases are anonymized and used to develop a patient cohort. All diagnoses and treatments are recorded in the course of routine medical practice.

group.title: Fluticasone Propionate and Salmeterol
group.description: Participants aged 65-79 years with 15-24 months of continuous enrollment (12 months pre-index and 3-12 months post-index), with asthma diagnosis, and who received (index) Fluticasone Propionate and Salmeterol 100 micrograms (mcg)/50 mcg, 250 mcg/50 mcg, and 500 mcg/50 mcg

group.title: Inhaled Corticosteroids
group.description: Participants aged 65-79 years with 15-24 months of continuous enrollment (12 months pre-index and 3-12 months post-index), with asthma diagnosis, and who received (index) Inhaled Corticosteroids (beclomethasone dipropionate, fluticasone propionate, mometasone furoate, triamcinolone, flunisolide, budesoninde). Due to the retrospective nature of this analysis, doses received and frequency of dosing are not known.

group.title: Fluticasone Propionate and Salmeterol
group.description: Participants aged 65-79 years with 15-24 months of continuous enrollment (12 months pre-index and 3-12 months post-index), with asthma diagnosis, and who received (index) Fluticasone Propionate and Salmeterol 100 micrograms (mcg)/50 mcg, 250 mcg/50 mcg, and 500 mcg/50 mcg

group.title: Inhaled Corticosteroids
group.description: Participants aged 65-79 years with 15-24 months of continuous enrollment (12 months pre-index and 3-12 months post-index), with asthma diagnosis, and who received (index) Inhaled Corticosteroids (beclomethasone dipropionate, fluticasone propionate, mometasone furoate, triamcinolone, flunisolide, budesoninde). Due to the retrospective nature of this analysis, doses received and frequency of dosing are not known.

measure.title: Number of participants with comorbid COPD at baseline

outcome.title: Mean Number of Post-index Asthma-related Events Measured Using Medical and Pharmacy Claims
outcome.description: Asthma-related events were defined as events with any primary ICD-9 code of 493.xx for hospitalizations, emergency department visits, and combined hospitalization/emergency department visits. The post-index period is defined as 3-12 months after either the first administration of fluticasone propionate and salmetrol or inhaled corticosteroids. Medical and pharmacy claims are recorded healthcare encounters in a large managed care administrative insurance database.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 years from July 1, 2001 to June 30, 2008
outcome.population: Participants contributing to the PharMetrics database (a large, multiplan insurance encounter database) who were identified in the study as having at least one pharmacy claim for fluticasone propionate/salmeterol or inhaled corticosteroids, had an ICD-9 code of 493.xx for asthma, and were at least 65 years of age within the time frame of the study.

group.title: Fluticasone Propionate and Salmeterol
group.description: Participants aged 65-79 years with 15-24 months of continuous enrollment (12 months pre-index and 3-12 months post-index), with asthma diagnosis, and who received (index) Fluticasone Propionate and Salmeterol 100 micrograms (mcg)/50 mcg, 250 mcg/50 mcg, and 500 mcg/50 mcg

group.title: Inhaled Corticosteroids
group.description: Participants aged 65-79 years with 15-24 months of continuous enrollment (12 months pre-index and 3-12 months post-index), with asthma diagnosis, and who received (index) Inhaled Corticosteroids (beclomethasone dipropionate, fluticasone propionate, mometasone furoate, triamcinolone, flunisolide, budesoninde). Due to the retrospective nature of this analysis, doses received and frequency of dosing are not known.

measure.title: Mean Number of Post-index Asthma-related Events Measured Using Medical and Pharmacy Claims
measure.description: Asthma-related events were defined as events with any primary ICD-9 code of 493.xx for hospitalizations, emergency department visits, and combined hospitalization/emergency department visits. The post-index period is defined as 3-12 months after either the first administration of fluticasone propionate and salmetrol or inhaled corticosteroids. Medical and pharmacy claims are recorded healthcare encounters in a large managed care administrative insurance database.
measure.population: Participants contributing to the PharMetrics database (a large, multiplan insurance encounter database) who were identified in the study as having at least one pharmacy claim for fluticasone propionate/salmeterol or inhaled corticosteroids, had an ICD-9 code of 493.xx for asthma, and were at least 65 years of age within the time frame of the study.

analysis.p_value_desc: The P-value relates to differences in combined inpatient/emergency department.

outcome.title: Mean Asthma-related Costs in the Post-index Period
outcome.description: Asthma-related costs were calculated as pharmacy costs, medical costs, and total asthma (pharmacy plus medical) costs. Medical costs were made up of asthma-related visits, hospitalizations, emergency department visits, and medical office visits. Pharmacy costs were comprised of all asthma-related medications used during the follow-up period. Medical services were identified by place of service and PharMetrics-specific confinement codes. Prescriptions were counted by 30-day fills, with fills less than 30 days rounded up to indicate one fill.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 7 years from July 1, 2001 to June 30, 2008
outcome.population: Participants contributing to the PharMetrics database (a large, multiplan insurance encounter database) who were identified in the study as having at least one pharmacy claim for fluticasone propionate/salmeterol or inhaled corticosteroids, had an ICD-9 code of 493.xx for asthma, and were at least 65 years of age within the time frame of the study.

group.description: Participants aged 65-79 years with 15-24 months of continuous enrollment (12 months pre-index and 3-12 months post-index), with asthma diagnosis, and who received (index) Fluticasone Propionate and Salmeterol 100 micrograms (mcg)/50 mcg, 250 mcg/50 mcg, and 500 mcg/50 mcg

Due to the retrospective nature of this analysis, doses received and frequency of dosing are not known.

measure.title: Mean Asthma-related Costs in the Post-index Period
measure.description: Asthma-related costs were calculated as pharmacy costs, medical costs, and total asthma (pharmacy plus medical) costs. Medical costs were made up of asthma-related visits, hospitalizations, emergency department visits, and medical office visits. Pharmacy costs were comprised of all asthma-related medications used during the follow-up period. Medical services were identified by place of service and PharMetrics-specific confinement codes. Prescriptions were counted by 30-day fills, with fills less than 30 days rounded up to indicate one fill.
measure.population: Participants contributing to the PharMetrics database (a large, multiplan insurance encounter database) who were identified in the study as having at least one pharmacy claim for fluticasone propionate/salmeterol or inhaled corticosteroids, had an ICD-9 code of 493.xx for asthma, and were at least 65 years of age within the time frame of the study.

analysis.p_value_desc: The P-value is on the adjusted difference in total asthma costs.
analysis.method_desc: Generalized Linear Model with a log-link and a gamma distribution adjusting for differences at baseline

outcome.title: Mean Number of Albuterol (Short-acting Î²-Agonists) Canisters Dispensed Per Pharmacy Claim Per Participant
outcome.description: The number of albuterol canisters dispensed was used as a surrogate marker of asthma symptoms.

reported_events.desc: This was a retrospective observational study using a large health insurance claims database. Serious adverse events and non-serious adverse events were not collected.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
